meanings.definition: A substance that is weakly attracted to a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: Paramagnets are materials that are slightly drawn towards magnets.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study paramagnets to understand how they react to magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The paramagnets in the lab couldn't decide if they wanted to stick to the magnet or not.
meanings.sent4: Like a curious child, paramagnets eagerly approach magnetic fields.
meanings.sent5: In the presence of a magnet, paramagnets exhibit a subtle attraction.

meanings.definition: Materials that are not permanently magnetized.
meanings.sent1: These paramagnets can be temporarily magnetized but do not retain the magnetism.
meanings.sent2: The paramagnets in the experiment lost their magnetism once the external magnetic field was removed.
meanings.sent3: The paramagnets behaved like forgetful magnets, only holding onto magnetism briefly.
meanings.sent4: Paramagnets are like magnets with short-term memory, easily losing their magnetic properties.
meanings.sent5: Unlike permanent magnets, paramagnets can only hold a magnetic charge temporarily.
